question: Find the units digit of $29 \cdot 79 + 31 \cdot 81$.
agents_response:
The units digit of a product or sum depends only on the units digits of the numbers involved. In particular, the units digit of $29 \cdot 79$ is the same as the units digit of $9 \cdot 9$, which is 1. Similarly, the units digit of $31 \cdot 81$ is the same as the units digit of $1 \cdot 1$, which is 1. 

So, the units digit of $29 \cdot 79 + 31 \cdot 81$ is the same as the units digit of $1 + 1$, which is \boxed{2}.
